p:
Outbreaks of MERS‐CoV now occur mostly due to animal‐to‐human transmission (probably during the camel calving season).
14 Person‐to‐person spread seems to depend on close contact, such as providing care to an infected person or within a hospital setting. In all, 40% of confirmed cases have been acquired nosocomially – on one day in May 2015, an individual with MERS visited several hospitals in Korea and infected 186 people.
11
